subject: Real Estate
title: Fair Housing: Protected Classes
description: A micro-lesson that makes Fair Housing: Protected Classes usable.

hook.text: In 1968, the Fair Housing Act made it illegal to refuse to rent based on race, religion, or national origin.

buildup.text: The law now protects seven classes: race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, and familial status.

discovery.text: Violations include refusing to show properties, steering buyers to certain neighborhoods, or different loan terms.

twist.text: Testing studies still find discrimination. Minority applicants receive fewer callbacks than identical white applicants.

climax.text: Fair housing law changed the rules, but enforcement depends on tenants willing to report violations.

punchline.text: The law banned housing discrimination. Reality is slower.

quiz.question: How many protected classes does the Fair Housing Act cover?
